subject: Re: [junit] Re. GUI testing
msgSnippet: ... Whoa there! Please suggest that your GUI developer take a deep breath and think relaxing thoughts. You could also suggest that they try chanting google is
messageBody:
On 8/16/06, Altman, Joel G. (JSC-CC)[LM] <joel.g.altman@...> wrote:
> After forwarding some of the replies I got from my previous question, my
> GUI programmer posed a further question.
>
> " The point I told you this morning was "DEVELOPING THE GUI INTERFACE".
> Here is the Questions you should ask him.

Whoa there! Please suggest that your GUI developer take a deep breath
and think relaxing thoughts. You could also suggest that they try
chanting "google is my friend".

> Point: Does JUnit have a GUI Development IDE?. With Drag and Drop
> features?.

No.

> That's why I said I am plying with netBeans and/or Java Studio 8. By the
> way Java Studio 8 is built on netBeans. netBeans do have the Graphical
> Drag and Drop Features to Build the GUIs Soon, than by laying out the
> interface by hand.
>
> I will be glad if he can tell me how to do this in Junit (point above).
> I can then forget netBeans or anything else.
>
> -Kumar"
>
>
> Joel Altman
> Shuttle Training Aircraft Project

Your GUI developer needs a different tool than JUnit for their GUI
testing. I don't write GUI's, so I can't help in any way other than
suggesting that the good folks at google may be of help.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.org
